com.soa.jbi.core

Interface ExchangeHandler


  • public interface ExchangeHandler
    Provivdes a synchronous "callback" interface for JBI components. This is an extension to the JBI specification so that messages can be delivered between components in the same thread. The SOA implementation of the NMR natively supports components that implement this interface. Any component implementing the ExchangeListener interface will be invoked with this callback when a message exchange is delivered to it. It will not have to call the accept() method on its delivery channel.
    Since:
    3.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle(javax.jbi.messaging.MessageExchange exchange)
      Delivers a message exchange to the listener.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        void handle(javax.jbi.messaging.MessageExchange exchange)
     throws javax.jbi.messaging.MessagingException
        Delivers a message exchange to the listener.
        Parameters:
        exchange - MessageExchange being delivered.
        Throws:
        javax.jbi.messaging.MessagingException - Thrown if the listener is unable to receive the exchange. This exception must not be thrown if the listener is unable to complete the exchange due to an internal error as this exception is reserved for indicating a message delivery problem only to the NMR. Listener internal errors should be reported in the exchange with the status of ERROR.
